contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox television |show_name=You Don't Look 40, Charlie Brown |image= |caption= Screenshot from special |genre= Animated TV special |format= |camera= |picture_format= |creator= |creative_director= |developer= |presenter= |starring= |voices= |narrated= |runtime=22 mins |theme_music_composer= |opentheme= |endtheme= |composer= |country={{USA}} |first_aired=February 2, [[1990 in television|1990]] |network=[[CBS]] |language=English |preceded_by= ''[[It's Your 20th Television Anniversary, Charlie Brown]]'' |followed_by= ''[[Good Grief, Charlie Brown: A Tribute to Charles Schulz]]'' }} '''''You Don't Look 40, Charlie Brown''''', the first ''[[Peanuts]]'' TV special of the 1990s, is one of many [[prime-time]] [[animation|animated]] [[TV special]]s, based on characters from the [[Charles M. Schulz]] [[comic strip]] ''[[Peanuts]]''. It originally aired on the [[CBS]] network on February 2, [[1990 in television|1990]]. Hosted by ''[[Knots Landing]]'' star [[Michele Lee]], this special includes a reunion of actors and actresses who voiced ''Peanuts'' characters from 1965 to 1989. Also included are a [[B.B. King]] performance of ''[[Snoopy|Joe Cool]]'' and clips from the seldom-seen 1973 [[Hallmark Hall of Fame]] live-action production of ''[[You're a Good Man, Charlie Brown]]''. Unlike the other ''Peanuts'' anniversary specials before and after, this was the only one that was released to home video by [[Paramount Home Video]]. ==Actors and actresses interviewed== *[[Brad Kesten (actor)|Brad Kesten]] (Charlie Brown, 1981–1986) * [[Chad Allen (actor)|Chad Allen]] (Charlie Brown, 1986) * Stuart Brotman (Peppermint Patty, 1975–1977) * Erin Chase (first girl to voice Charlie Brown, 1988–1989) * [[Sally Dryer]] (Lucy van Pelt, 1966–1968) * [[Robin Kohn]] (Lucy van Pelt, 1972–1973) * [[Bill Meléndez|Bill Melendez]] (other segments; Snoopy & Woodstock 1965-2006) * [[Jeremy Miller]] (Linus van Pelt, 1985–1986) * Geoffrey Ornstein (Pigpen, 1965) * [[Peter Robbins (actor)|Peter Robbins]] (original Charlie Brown, 1965–1969) * Heather Stoneman (Lucy van Pelt, 1984–1985) {{Peanuts television specials}} [[Category:Peanuts television documentaries]] [[Category:1990 television specials]] [[Category:1990 in American television]] {{Animation-tv-prog-stub}}
